name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings C10, C11, C12, C20, C21, C22, C30, C31, C40, C41, C42,C43, C44, C45, C50, C60, C61
1.3 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: EMP,& SWMS.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of excavation.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area has been set out in accordance with the drawings
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Verify using GPS Model

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit or DBYD must be issued prior to any excavation commencing. Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task. Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In situ material within 400mm of cut floor level to be consistent with Type B. i.e. CBR>assigned value (must be greater than 2), Swell < 2.5%. If parameter met, rip and re compact 150mm. If parameters not met remove 400mm of material and replace with conforming type B.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection, Test Report
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP, Test Report

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type A material without stabilisation to the satisfaction of the Geotech Engineer
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP, Area treated detailed on marked up drawing
FREQUENCY: Prior construction of the regulating layer.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of subgrade shall be presented for acceptance. Bulk Excavation Level Confirmed.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection, Document Review, GPS Model, Proof Rolling
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP, Photos, Videos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where unsuitable material is encountered, proposed in-situ treatment must be submitted to the Project Manager for review.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Visual Inspection, Proof Roll
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP & Test Reports

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where groundwater is encountered the contractor shall notify the Project Manager who shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP & Test Reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 200mm Compacted Thickness of 40mm recycled crushed concrete placed in 100mm layers
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ GPS Survey Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 200mm Compacted Thickness of 20mm Class 2 crushed rock placed in 100mm layers
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ GPS Survey Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ GPS Survey Report

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No visible deformation or springing. Pneumatic tyred plant nominated for test rolling procedures shall have a mass of not less than 15 tonne and shall have a ground contact pressure under either the front or rear wheels of not less than 450 kPa per tyre.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP, Photos, Videos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subbase Rock layers to have minimum compaction 98%.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP & Test Report
